The UdÄna Verses, Miscellaneous Aggregates, Part 5, Section 2: Those who sever the roots of goodness, how do they sever them?
In what aspects do they sever them?
It is like this: There is one who intentionally kills his mother and father, and has no subsequent shame or regret.
Again, there is one who intentionally kills his mother and father, and has subsequent shame and regret.

In this way, these two people follow various Å›ramaá¹‡as or brÄhmaá¹‡as, the Utkala or their followers, who hold the view of non-existence, establish the doctrine of non-existence, say there are no causes, say there is no action, and claim that all good and evil karma are completely severed and destroyed.
They often go to ask:ğŸ”½What is good?
What is not good?
What is sinful?
What is sinless?
What should one do to accomplish good and not evil?

Because of associating with, serving, and making offerings to such a teacher, they do not give rise to shame and remorse for the offenses they have committed, and if shame and remorse have already arisen, they quickly dispel them, saying:
Killing living beings is foolish, false, and has no result, no meaning, no arising, no flavor, and no benefit.
There is no killing living beings, and there is no ripening of results experienced from killing living beings.

Likewise, taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, false speech, divisive speech, harsh speech, frivolous speech, covetousness, malice, and wrong view are all foolish, false, and have no result, no meaning, no arising, no flavor, and no benefit.
There is no wrong view, and there is no ripening of results experienced from wrong view.
They deeply delight in and accept this explanation.

Because they deeply delight in and endure this matter and reveal it, it is said that such people tread the left path, namely, wrong views, wrong thoughts, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, and wrong concentration.

Because they tread this left path, the three kinds of wholesome roots gradually diminish, become weak and interrupted, while the three kinds of unwholesome roots gradually increase, become fierce and rampant;
the three kinds of good conduct gradually diminish, become weak and interrupted, while the three kinds of evil conduct gradually increase, become fierce and rampant;
the ten wholesome courses of action gradually diminish, become weak and interrupted, while the ten evil courses of action gradually increase, become fierce and rampant;
the eightfold right path gradually diminishes, becomes weak and interrupted, while the eightfold left path gradually increases, becomes fierce and rampant.

Because of killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, false speech, divisive speech, harsh speech, frivolous speech, greed, ill-will, and wrong views increasing and expanding, they mostly dwell in restlessness and mostly dwell in lack of restraint.

Although for a short time they give rise to weak wholesome thoughts and mental factors that accompany right view, they still mostly engage in various unwholesome dharmas and mostly dwell in the left-side category.

It is like when one passes through the hot summer and enters the cool autumn, the night is covered with dark clouds, there is thunder and lightning that momentarily emit light, and as soon as one sees various colors they quickly disappear again.

In this way, those people mostly dwell in restlessness and mostly dwell in lack of restraint, although for a short time they give rise to weak wholesome thoughts and mental factors that accompany right view, they still mostly engage in various unwholesome dharmas and mostly dwell in the left-side category.
It is just as if someone, in the last month of spring or the first month of summer, when it is hot, dry, and dusty, were to enter a cool pond and bathe in the clear, cool water.
After bathing and drinking, he would quickly come out, and all the coarse drops would fall off, leaving only the fine drops remaining in his pores.

In the same way, that person, who mostly dwells in non-tranquility and non-discipline, although he has given rise to a slight and inferior wholesome mind and mental factors that accompany right view, still various unwholesome dharmas mostly manifest and he mostly dwells in the left category.
Later, he is also able to harm the lives of superior beings without subsequent remorse, and ultimately denies the existence of all wholesome and unwholesome karmic retributions.

Because he harms the lives of superior beings without subsequent remorse, and ultimately denies the existence of all wholesome and unwholesome karmic retributions, it is said that this person has severed the wholesome roots belonging to the three realms, namely those belonging to the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

One should know that such a person cannot continue to cultivate wholesome roots in this present life, but will definitely continue to cultivate wholesome roots at the time of death in hell or at the time of rebirth.
Question:
If one kills such a person or kills an ant egg or a crippled ant, which is more serious?
Answer:
If the defilements are equal, the retribution is also equal.
There is another explanation: The sin obtained from killing an ant egg or a crippled ant is greater, not from killing such a person.
Why is it so?
Because ant eggs and crippled ants do not sever wholesome roots, but such a type of person severs wholesome roots.
By such kinds of bodily actions, verbal actions, thoughts, aspirations, and practices, it is called wrong nature.
Because of this, one abandons the previously accomplished thoughts, conceptual thoughts, and provisional verbal expressions, and abides in the indeterminate aggregate and indeterminate disposition.

Because of this, one obtains the conceptualization, conceptualized objects, and verbal expressions that one has not previously accomplished, and abides in the class of those with wrong determination and the nature of those with wrong determination.

One obtains the five kinds of persons, the mixed types, the accompanying types, the evil class of sentient beings, the attainment of places, the attainment of events, and the attainment of the place of growth, namely, killing one's mother, killing one's father, killing an arhat, disrupting the harmony of the Saá¹…gha, and maliciously drawing blood from a buddha.
Those who sever the roots of goodness sever them in this way, with this aspect of severing.

There is a type of person who, due to a defiled mind belonging to the desire realm that is present, either abandons the roots of goodness without obtaining them, or obtains them without abandoning them, or both abandons and obtains them, or neither abandons nor obtains them.
Abandoning without obtaining refers to when the roots of goodness are severed.

And ordinary beings who have already separated from desire of the desire realm, due to the desire realm bonds regressing, abandon the roots of goodness belonging to the form and formless realms without obtaining them.
Ordinary beings who have already abandoned craving for the desire realm, when regressing due to the bonds of the desire realm, abandon wholesome roots bound to the form realm but do not obtain them.
Learners who have already abandoned craving for the form realm, when regressing due to the bonds of the desire realm, abandon wholesome roots bound to the formless realm but do not obtain them.
This is called abandoning but not obtaining.
Obtaining but not abandoning refers to when one continues wholesome roots with a deluded mind.

Both abandoning and obtaining refers to when one falls from the formless realm and is reborn in the desire realm, abandoning wholesome roots bound to the formless realm and obtaining wholesome roots bound to the desire realm.
When one falls from the form realm and is reborn in the desire realm, abandoning wholesome roots bound to the form realm and obtaining wholesome roots bound to the desire realm.

Arhats, when regressing due to the bonds of the desire realm, abandon wholesome roots bound to the formless realm and the wholesome roots of non-learners, and obtain the wholesome roots of learners, regressing from the mind of non-learner and abiding in the mind of learner.
This is called both abandoning and obtaining.
Neither abandoning nor obtaining refers to when one does not sever wholesome roots, falling from the desire realm and being reborn in the desire realm.
This is called neither abandoning nor obtaining.

There is another type of person who, due to the present manifestation of defiled minds bound to the form realm, either abandons or does not abandon, or both abandons and obtains, or neither abandons nor obtains wholesome roots.

Abandoning but not obtaining refers to those who have already abandoned craving for the form realm, whether learners or ordinary beings, who regress due to the bonds of the form realm, abandoning wholesome roots bound to the formless realm but not obtaining them.
When passing away from the desire realm and being reborn in the form realm, they abandon wholesome roots bound to the desire realm but do not obtain them.
This is called abandoning but not obtaining.

Both abandoning and obtaining refers to when passing away from the formless realm and being reborn in the form realm, abandoning wholesome roots bound to the formless realm and obtaining wholesome roots bound to the form realm.

When arhats regress due to the bonds of the form realm, they abandon wholesome roots bound to the formless realm and wholesome roots of the stage of no further learning, and obtain wholesome roots of the stage of learning, regressing from the mind of no further learning and abiding in the mind of the stage of learning.
This is called both abandoning and obtaining.
Not abandoning and not obtaining refers to one who dies in the form realm and is reborn in the form realm.
This is called not abandoning and not obtaining.

There is another type of person who, due to defiled minds bound to the formless realm appearing before them, either abandons or does not obtain wholesome roots, or both abandons and obtains, or neither abandons nor obtains.
Abandoning but not obtaining refers to one who dies in the desire realm and is reborn in the formless realm, abandoning but not obtaining wholesome roots bound to the desire realm and form realm.
Dying in the form realm and being reborn in the formless realm, abandoning but not obtaining wholesome roots bound to the form realm.
This is called abandoning but not obtaining.

Both abandoning and obtaining refers to an arhat who regresses from the formless realm, abandoning the wholesome roots of the non-learner and obtaining the wholesome roots of the learner, regressing from the non-learner's mind and abiding in the learner's mind.
This is called both abandoning and obtaining.
Not abandoning and not obtaining refers to one who dies in the formless realm and is reborn in the formless realm.
This is called neither abandoning nor obtaining.

Furthermore, there are twelve sense bases, namely the eye sense base and form sense base, the ear sense base and sound sense base, the nose sense base and smell sense base, the tongue sense base and taste sense base, the body sense base and touch sense base, and the mind sense base and dharma sense base.
What is the eye sense base?
It refers to the eye sense base that has seen forms, is seeing forms, or will see forms, or to any other homogeneous eye sense base.
What is the homogeneous eye sense base?
It refers to the homogeneous eye sense base, whether past, future, or present.
What is the past homogeneous eye sense base?
It refers to the eye sense base that has ceased without seeing forms.
What is the future homogeneous eye sense base?
It refers to the eye sense base that is either definitely not going to arise in the future, or that will arise but will cease without seeing forms.
What is the present homogeneous eye sense base?
It refers to the eye sense base that is ceasing without seeing forms.
What is the form sense base?
It refers to the form realm that the eye has already seen, is now seeing, or will see, or other form realms that are of the same type.
What is the form realm that is of the same type?
It refers to the form realm that is of the same type, whether past, future, or present.
What is the past form realm that is of the same type?
It refers to the form realm that the eye has already seen and has ceased.
What is the future form realm that is of the same type?
It refers to the form realm that either will definitely not arise in the future, or that will arise in the future but the eye will not see and will cease.
What is the present form realm that is of the same type?
It refers to the form realm that the eye does not see and is ceasing in the present.
The same applies to the ear and sound realms, the nose and smell realms, the tongue and taste realms, and the body and touch realms.
What is the mind realm?
It refers to the mental faculty that has already cognized dharmas, is now cognizing dharmas, or will cognize dharmas, or to the other homogeneous mental faculty.
What is the homogeneous mental faculty?
It refers to the mental faculty that exists in the future but will definitely not arise. There is no past or present homogeneous mental faculty, nor is there a homogeneous dharma faculty.

There are eighteen realms, namely, the eye realm, form realm, eye-consciousness realm, ear realm, sound realm, ear-consciousness realm, nose realm, smell realm, nose-consciousness realm, tongue realm, taste realm, tongue-consciousness realm, body realm, touch realm, body-consciousness realm, mind realm, dharma realm, mind-consciousness realm.ğŸ”½Can it be that the eye realm is already eliminated and completely known, and so is the form realm?

There are twelve minds, namely: a wholesome mind, an unwholesome mind, an obscured-neutral mind, and an unobscured-neutral mind bound to the desire realm; a wholesome mind, an obscured-neutral mind, and an unobscured-neutral mind bound to the form realm; a wholesome mind, an obscured-neutral mind, and an unobscured-neutral mind bound to the formless realm; and a learner's mind and an adept's mind.
These twelve minds are either past, future, or present.
There are four sentences regarding a past wholesome mind bound to the desire realm:

That is to say, it may be that which has already been cognized but is neither being cognized now nor will be cognized in the future; or it may be that which has already been cognized and will be cognized in the future but is not being cognized now; or it may be that which has already been cognized and is being cognized now but will not be cognized in the future; or it may be that which has already been cognized and is being cognized now and will be cognized in the future.
That which has already been cognized but is neither being cognized now nor will be cognized in the future refers to the noble individuals who are born in the form and formless realms.

As for those who have already discriminated and will discriminate but do not now discriminate, it refers to those who have already severed wholesome roots and ordinary beings born in the form and formless realms.ğŸ”½As for those who have already discriminated and now discriminate but will not discriminate, it refers to non-returners born in the desire realm who are heading towards the form and formless realms and abide in the final wholesome mind.
As for those who have already discriminated, now discriminate, and will discriminate, it refers to those born in the desire realm who have not severed wholesome roots and abide in their own nature.
As with the past, so it is with the future.

There are four cases for the wholesome mind of the desire realm that has not yet been obtained:ğŸ”½Either it is not yet discriminated, is not now discriminated, and will not be discriminated, or it is not yet discriminated, is not now discriminated, but will be discriminated, or it is not yet discriminated, is not now discriminated, but may or may not be discriminated, or it is now discriminated and will be discriminated but is not yet discriminated.
As for that which is not yet discriminated, is not now discriminated, and will not be discriminated, it refers to that which has not yet been obtained and will definitely not be obtained.

As for those that are not yet cognized, are not now being cognized, and will be cognized, this refers to those that have not yet been obtained and will definitely be obtained in the future.ğŸ”½As for those that are not yet cognized, are not now being cognized, and may or may not be cognized, this refers to those that have not yet been obtained and may or may not be obtained in the future.
As for those that are now being cognized and will be cognized but are not yet cognized, this refers to those that have not yet been obtained and are appearing for the first time.
There are three cases for the present wholesome mind bound to the desire realm:

Either it is already cognized, is now being cognized, but will not be cognized, or it is not yet cognized, is now being cognized, and will be cognized, or it is already cognized, is now being cognized, and will be cognized.

As for that which is already cognized, is now being cognized, but will not be cognized, this refers to those who are born in the desire realm and are non-returners who have attained the formless realm, abiding in the final wholesome mind.
As for that which is not yet cognized, is now being cognized, and will be cognized, this refers to those who have not yet obtained it and are experiencing it for the first time.
As for those that have been cognized, are being cognized, and will be cognized, it means those that have been obtained in the past and are presently manifest.
There are seven cases for past unwholesome minds:

Either they have been cognized but are not being cognized and will not be cognized, or they have been cognized but are not being cognized and will be cognized, or they have been cognized but are not being cognized and either will or will not be cognized, or they have been cognized and are being cognized but will not be cognized, or they have been cognized and are being cognized and will be cognized, or they have been cognized and are being cognized and either will or will not be cognized, or they have been cognized and are being cognized and will be cognized.ğŸ”½As for those that have been cognized but are not being cognized and will not be cognized, it means those who have already abandoned craving for the desire realm and will definitely not retrogress from abandoning craving for the desire realm.

As for those that have been cognized but are not being cognized and will be cognized, it means those who have already abandoned craving for the desire realm and will retrogress from abandoning craving for the desire realm.

As for those who have already cognized but are not now cognizing or will not necessarily cognize in the future or will not necessarily not cognize in the future, it refers to those who have already abandoned craving for the desire realm, who may or may not retrogress from abandoning craving after having abandoned it.

As for those who have already cognized and are now cognizing but will not necessarily cognize in the future, it refers to those abiding in the abandonment of craving, who attain the abandonment of craving in the uninterrupted path, and who will definitely not retrogress from the abandonment of craving.

As for those who have already cognized, are now cognizing, and will cognize in the future, it refers to those abiding in the abandonment of craving, who attain the abandonment of craving in the uninterrupted path, and who will definitely retrogress from the abandonment of craving.

As for those who have already cognized, are now cognizing, and will either cognize in the future or will not necessarily cognize in the future, it refers to those abiding in the abandonment of craving, who attain the abandonment of craving in the uninterrupted path, and who may or may not retrogress from the abandonment of craving.

As for those who have already cognized, are now cognizing, and will cognize in the future, it refers to those who have not yet abandoned craving for the desire realm, abiding in their intrinsic nature.
As with the past, so it is with the future.
As for the present non-virtuous mind, there is one sentence:
It is that which has already been cognized, is now being cognized, and will be cognized, namely, when a wholesome mind is presently manifest.
There are seven cases for past desire-realm-connected obscured indeterminate minds:

Either it has already been cognized but is not now being cognized and will not be cognized, or it has already been cognized but is not now being cognized and will be cognized, or it has already been cognized but is not now being cognized and either will or will not be cognized, or it has already been cognized and is now being cognized but will not be cognized, or it has already been cognized and is now being cognized and will be cognized, or it has already been cognized and is now being cognized and either will or will not be cognized, or it has already been cognized and is now being cognized and will be cognized.

That which has already been cognized but is not now being cognized and will not be cognized refers to those who have already abandoned desire for the desire realm and are ordinary beings, who will definitely not retrogress from abandoning desire after they have abandoned desire;
and to noble ones who have not yet abandoned desire for the desire realm, for whom the knowledge of dharmas regarding suffering at the stage of the path of seeing has already arisen.

As for those who have already discerned but are not now discerning and will not discern, this refers to ordinary beings who have already abandoned craving for the desire realm but will definitely fall back from abandoning craving.

As for those who have already discerned but are not now discerning or will or will not discern, this refers to ordinary beings who have already abandoned craving for the desire realm but may or may not fall back from abandoning craving.

As for those who have already discerned and are now discerning but will not discern, this refers to ordinary beings dwelling in the abandonment of craving for the desire realm, who attain the abandonment of craving in the uninterrupted path, and will definitely not fall back from the abandonment of craving.

It also refers to noble ones who have not yet abandoned craving for the desire realm, for whom the knowledge of dharmas in relation to suffering at the stage of entry into the stream has not yet arisen.

As for those who have already discerned and are now discerning and will discern, this refers to ordinary beings dwelling in the abandonment of craving for the desire realm, who attain the abandonment of craving in the uninterrupted path, and will definitely fall back from the abandonment of craving.
